children.value: A session controls how data is synchronized between a single Realm on the device and the server Realm on the Realm Object Server.
A Session is created by opening a Realm instance using a
. Once a session has been created, it will continue to exist until the app is closed or all threads using this
A session is controlled by Realm, but can provide additional information in case of errors. These errors are passed along in the

When creating a session, Realm will establish a connection to the server. This connection is controlled by Realm and might be shared between multiple sessions. It is possible to get insight into the connection using
The session itself has a different lifecycle than the underlying connection. The state of the session can be found using
that is responsible for controlling the session.
that is used to connect to MongoDB Realm.
describing the remote Realm which this session connects to and synchronizes changes with.
Get the current session's state, as defined in
Get the current state of the connection used by the session as defined in
Checks if the session is connected to the server and can synchronize data.
Adds a progress listener tracking changes that need to be downloaded from the Realm Object Server.
Adds a progress listener tracking changes that need to be uploaded from the device to the Realm Object Server.
Adds a listener tracking changes to the connection backing this session.
Calling this method will block until all known remote changes have been downloaded and applied to the Realm.
Calling this method will block until all known remote changes have been downloaded and applied to the Realm or the specified timeout is hit.
Calling this method will block until all known local changes have been uploaded to the server.
Calling this method will block until all known local changes have been uploaded to the server or the specified timeout is hit.
Attempts to start the session and enable synchronization with the Realm Object Server.
Stops any synchronization with the Realm Object Server until the Realm is re-opened again after fully closing it.
that is responsible for controlling the session.
that is used to connect to MongoDB Realm.
describing the remote Realm which this session connects to and synchronizes changes with.
Get the current session's state, as defined in
Note that the state may change after this method returns.
Get the current state of the connection used by the session as defined in

Checks if the session is connected to the server and can synchronize data. This is a best guess effort. To conserve battery the underlying implementation uses heartbeats to detect if the connection is still available. So if no data is actively being synced and some time has elapsed since the last heartbeat, the connection could have been dropped but this method will still return
Adds a progress listener tracking changes that need to be downloaded from the Realm Object Server.
will be triggered immediately when registered, and periodically afterwards.
Adds a progress listener tracking changes that need to be uploaded from the device to the Realm Object Server.
will be triggered immediately when registered, and periodically afterwards.
Removes a progress listener. If the listener wasn't registered, this method will do nothing.
Adds a listener tracking changes to the connection backing this session. See

Calling this method will block until all known remote changes have been downloaded and applied to the Realm. This will involve network access, so calling this method should only be done from a non-UI thread.
If the device is offline, this method might never return.
This method cannot be called before the session has been started.

Calling this method will block until all known remote changes have been downloaded and applied to the Realm or the specified timeout is hit. This will involve network access, so calling this method should only be done from a non-UI thread.
This method cannot be called before the Realm has been opened.
Calling this method will block until all known local changes have been uploaded to the server. This will involve network access, so calling this method should only be done from a non-UI thread.
If the device is offline, this method might never return.
This method cannot be called before the Realm has been opened.

Calling this method will block until all known local changes have been uploaded to the server or the specified timeout is hit. This will involve network access, so calling this method should only be done from a non-UI thread.
This method cannot be called before the Realm has been opened.
Attempts to start the session and enable synchronization with the Realm Object Server.
This happens automatically when opening the Realm instance, so doing it manually should only be needed if the session was stopped using
If the session was already started, calling this method will do nothing.

, the session will be moved back to
Stops any synchronization with the Realm Object Server until the Realm is re-opened again after fully closing it.
Synchronization can be re-enabled by calling
If the session is already stopped, calling this method will do nothing.
